channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Education Dept. cuts could hurt low-income schools. And, an entertainment rundown
item.description: President Trump signed an executive action yesterday to start shutting down the Education Department, which could hurt low-income and rural schools. A...

item.title: Trump wants to erase DEI. Researchers worry it will upend work on health disparity
item.description: Cancer researchers working on health disparities say President Trump's actions could hurt rural whites, who lag behind other groups in cancer screenin...

item.title: Families of deported Venezuelans dispute gang claims after deportations under Alien Enemies Act
item.description: NPR talked to the families of four men believed to be in El Salvador. None of them had a serious criminal record in the U.S. Only some had been charge...

item.title: Court hearing to test legality of deportations under 18th century law
item.description: Friday's hearing over the merits of the judge's temporary restraining order comes as the case has become a flashpoint between the judiciary and execut...

item.title: Japanese Breakfast's Michelle Zauner embraces melancholy in new album
item.description: With a new album, Michelle Zauner tells NPR she is finally finding balance between all the things she yearns for: her career goals, a connection to fa...

item.title: Tesla vandals face up to 20 years in prison, says attorney general
item.description: The US attorney general said a wave of vandalism and arson attacks at Tesla dealerships is "domestic terrorism".

item.title: Facing anti-DEI investigations, colleges cut ties with nonprofit targeted by conservatives
item.description: The U.S. Education Department says it has investigated dozens of universities for alleged racial discrimination, citing ties to a nonprofit organizati...

item.title: Detentions of European tourists at US borders spark fears of traveling to America
Idaho murders suspect selfie puts focus on "bushy eyebrows" evidence
item.description: Prosecutors say they intend to introduce what appears to be a selfie Bryan Kohberger took on his phone just hours after the killings.

item.title: Some voters are pushing back on lawmakers’ efforts to overturn citizen ballot initiatives
London's Heathrow Airport closed for day due to power outage from nearby fire
item.description: A fire at an electrical substation has shut down London's Heathrow Airport, impacting thousands of travelers across the globe.

item.title: Netanyahu fires Israel's security chief over 'distrust'
item.description: The Israeli PM cited Shin Bet's failure to anticipate the 7 October attack - but the move has sparked outrage and protests.

item.title: Trump signs order to dismantle US education department
item.description: The move, which he promised to do on the campaign trail, is already facing legal challenges.

item.title: 3/20: The Daily Report
item.description: Kelly O'Grady reports on the newly signed executive order targeting the Department of Education, new details from last year's bridge collapse in Balti...

item.title: Boston Celtics sold for $6.1 billion
item.description: The Boston Celtics are being sold​ to Bill Chisholm for $6.1 billion.

item.title: Second night of protest breaks out in Turkey despite ban
item.description: Some 37 people have been arrested for "provocative" social media posts, the interior ministry says.

item.title: Trump says judge in migrant deportations case is 'Grandstander'
item.description: The judge says the government's filing in the case is "woefully insufficient", but Trump calls him a "Grandstander".

item.title: 3/20: CBS Evening News Plus
item.description: What's next for the Education Department after Trump orders its closure; Reporter's Notebook: Why spring is nature's happiness report
